column5: OverviewThis masters degree in accounting will equip you with the skills and knowledge required to succeed in any career or aspect of business that requires expertise in accounting – in private, public or third sector organisations. It aims to provide you with a route to gain professional qualifications in all of the key accounting associations, and has been designed with a focus on the Association of Chartered Certified Accountants. The MSc includes six mandatory courses and two elective courses.
column7: UK - £8,320 (full-time) and £4,160 (part-time), individual courses are £1,040 Overseas - £18,520 (full-time) and £9,260 (part-time), individual courses are £2,315
